meanings.definition: To display or create an image in pixels.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys pixellating her artwork to make it digital.
meanings.sent2: The computer is pixellating the photo for the website.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally started pixellating her painting, turning it into a digital masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: His mind was pixellating the memory, breaking it down into small, distinct parts.
meanings.sent5: The screen was pixellating with vibrant colors, creating a mesmerizing display.

meanings.definition: To break down an image into pixels.
meanings.sent1: The software is pixellating the high-resolution image for online use.
meanings.sent2: When zoomed in, the picture starts pixellating, losing its clarity.
meanings.sent3: The detective was pixellating the surveillance footage to identify the suspect.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pixellate the memory, fragmenting it into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent5: The old TV was pixellating the movie, making it hard to watch.

meanings.definition: The act of converting an image into pixels.
meanings.sent1: The pixellating of the photograph was done with precision.
meanings.sent2: He studied the pixellating of images in his digital art class.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected pixellating of the painting gave it a unique look.
meanings.sent4: The pixellating of the logo transformed it into a digital format.
meanings.sent5: The artist's skillful pixellating brought the image to life on screen.
